title: [BUG] log-param REST call doesn't return reason for failure

labels.name: Acknowledged
labels.description: This issue has been read and acknowledged by the MLflow admins.

labels.name: area/tracking
labels.description: Tracking service, tracking client APIs, autologging

labels.name: priority/important-longterm

body:
### System information - **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: Yes - **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: CentOS 7 - **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: binary - **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: 1.7 - **Python version**: 3.8 - **npm version, if running the dev UI**: 20.0.2 - **Exact command to reproduce**: 1. Setup environment variables to connect on a mlflow server: ``` export MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI= export MLFLOW_TRACKING_USERNAME= export MLFLOW_TRACKING_PASSWORD= ``` 2. Create an experiment logging a parameter with a string value over 500 bytes ``` with mlflow.start_run(): mlflow.log_param("A parameter", "Over 500 bytes string...") ``` 3. Run you experiment python3 your_file.py .... ### Describe the problem The rest API will return a generic error message. We should see an error message indicating the maximum value are exceeded. I assume this maximum is intended because it is specified in the API documentation: https://www.mlflow.org/docs/latest/rest-api.html#log-param Therefore, there is no reason not to give information regarding this error. ### Other info / logs Only the following message is returned: > ERROR mlflow.utils.rest_utils: API request to MLFLOW_SERVER/api/2.0/mlflow/runs/log-parameter failed with code 500 != 200, retrying up to 2 more times. API response body: > 500 Internal Server Error >

Internal Server Error

>

The server encountered an internal error and was unable to complete your request. Either the server is overloaded or there is an error in the application.
